alert.note: Alert for Flathead, Mission Valleys (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 01 at 6:05AM MST until February 02 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches possible, with isolated higher amounts. Winds gusting as high as 40 to 50 mph may create blowing and drifting snow, greatly reducing visibility during the afternoon and evening commute. Wet roads may quickly freeze as the arctic front passes. * WHERE...Flathead Lake, Flathead Valley, Mission Valley, and Polson. * WHEN...From 5 PM MST this afternoon through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be affected. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
